content.div:
A dead puppy: there's a harsh way to open a music video -- particularly one from Feist, soft-pop sweetheart and Canada's unofficial ambassador to Sesame Street.

"The Bad In Each Other," a new music video off the singer/songwriter's 2011 disc, Metals, arrived today, and like that opening shot might suggest, the clip, shot in Mexico by director Martin De Thurah, carries less whimsy than, say, "I Feel it All." There are still fireworks, though! And there's still some good to be found in the frames-- a few warm fuzzies, as well. If anything, the video -- a day-in-the-life narrative which drops in on a cast of disparate characters, Feist included -- brings up mixed emotions. But going off a statement posted to Feist's official website today, a mess of feelings is really the point.

"This video captures glimpses of something human, we get a peek inside something real between people -- could be loss, longing and love. A lot of things which is about being a human being...It is told in a way where it opens up more aspects than it concludes," reads the post.

"You could think about the video like a song or a poem, and different people will connect to different things -- and those connections might be different from time to time when they watch it."

Watch "The Bad In Each Other" below:

leahc@dose.ca

link.Abstract: Sex, drugs and cartoon violence. 2011's best music videos had all that and a special appearance from Spock.

link.Abstract: We're not saying they're the best -- or even the worst -- but for whatever reason we couldn't get enough of these 10 pop stars in 2011.
link.title: 10 Pop Stars We Couldn't Stop Talking About in 2011

link.Abstract: Nicki Minaj released new song "Stupid Hoe" today. The lyrics would seem to confirm that she'll appear at the Super Bowl with Madonna (and also that she thinks someone is a "stupid hoe").

entry.title: The 2012 Coachella Line-up Is Here; The Black Keys, Radiohead, Dr. Dre and Snoop Dogg to Headline Back-to-Back Weekends

link.Abstract: The Black Keys, Radiohead and Dr. Dre and Snoop Dogg will headline the 2012 Coachella festival, which will run as back-to-back weekend events April 13-15 and April 20-22. The full line-up was announced Monday.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: That sweaty mob? It could be you! The line-up for Coachella 2012 is here.
link.title: Coachella

link.Abstract: Arcade Fire, Kanye West, The Strokes and a metric butt-load of other awesome bands played the 2011 edition of Coachella, in Indio, CA April 15-17. We've got the pictures.
link.title: Photos: Coachella 2011

link.Abstract: From Madge to Minaj, these are the albums Dose.ca is looking forward to in early 2012.
link.title: Spring 2012 Music Preview

link.Abstract: When the Black Keys started out, "the music industry needed a kick in the pants." Now the blues-rock duo is winning Grammys and topping charts. Their latest album, El Camino, is out today.
link.title: Interview: The Black Keys on Rock 'n' Roll and Kicking Butt

link.Abstract: Listen up! We've got reviews of new music from Amy Winehouse, The Black Keys, Charlotte Gainsbourg, The Roots and Robin Thicke.
link.title: Album Reviews (Amy Winehouse, The Black Keys, The Roots and More)

link.Abstract: The rapper posed in his classic Westside cruising style before helping Daria look-a-like Alexis take home a mint 1962 Lincoln Continental Convertible.
link.title: Watch Snoop Dogg Help a Hipster Win a Vintage Car on The Price is Right

link.Abstract: The Weeknd is holding an open call for auditions. The Toronto R&B act behind House of Balloons is seeking a guitarist and bass player, suggesting concert dates may be in the cards.
link.title: The Weeknd Wants You! (So Long As You're Awesome on Guitar And/Or Bass and Live in Toronto)

link.Abstract: Review: The Weeknd, Echoes of Silence
link.title: Review: The Weeknd, Echoes of Silence

link.Abstract: Florence + The Machine covered Drake's "Take Care" during an appearance at BBC 1's Live Lounge. Hear it here.
link.title: Video: Florence + The Machine Take On Drake's 'Take Care'

link.Abstract: Run, Florence, run! There's a supernatural hit on Florence + The Machine in new video "No Light, No Light." Watch it here.
link.title: Video: Florence + The Machine Dabble in Dark Arts For 'No Light, No Light' Clip

link.Abstract: Florence + The Machine, Kelly Clarkson, Jennifer Hudson, Jessie J, Mary J. Blige and more "celebrated soul" during the VH1 Divas special Dec. 18 in New York. We've got pictures.
link.title: Photos: Florence + The Machine, Kelly Clarkson and More are VH1 Divas
